CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1952, pg. 1, reads: "East Liberty Merchants Paint Windows For Xmas - Businessmen of the 5800 block on Penn Avenue sponsored a competition among the art students of five high schools as they sought to brighten their display windows for the Yule season. Here are the winners.  A group of singers frame the famous painting 'Ecce Home [Homo],' by nineteenth century religious painter Thomas Nast in first prize-winning scene, displayed in the window of Mrs. Tina Arnold, a tailor." ... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Exterior of Tina Arnold Custom Tailor store, with Christmas carolers on store window painted by Lois Day and Deloris Bowser, surrounding copy of Thomas Nast "Ecce Homo" painting, 5800 block of Penn Avenue, East Liberty
